result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARK J LEVEQUE

defendant.name: LEVEQUE, MARK J
defendant.address: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM Defendant MARK J LEVEQUE appeared in custody, by video.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he'd like to take this case federal - federal court, federal DA and federal judge. Court states if the defendant does not qualify for the public defender, the Court will appoint counsel. Court will schedule competency hearing after the defendant has counsel. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. 

Court adjourned at 3:53 PM.
Second appearance on September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:12 AM Defendant MARK J LEVEQUE in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has received the competency report. Before going on the record the defendant states that Atty Kapelis is his attorney and he refuses and says he is not his attorney. Defendant concurs. Court sets for Status of Counsel on September 21, 2022 at 3:30 PM

Court adjourned at 10:13 AM
by Nancy A. Elliott, Ph.D., ABPP dated 09/01/2022
by Department of Health Services                  (NOTE: emailed to WFU at 12:48 PM / received confirmation at 12:49 PM)
Status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination by department of Health Services

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge Slate from Ruth Zouski-Waushara County Corporation Counsel dated 07/12/2022 re: defendant is under a guardianship in Waushara County

9:46 AM Defendant MARK J LEVEQUE in court, in custody. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes statement regarding bond conditions. Court leaves bond as is. Court orders a competency hearing and finds good cause to waive the time limits based on the order for competency. Court will set for Status Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10;00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:49 AM
